projects.name: Pikku-Finlandia

project_type.description: Fully demountable timber pavilion designed for relocation - world-leading Design for Disassembly

projects.circularity_qualification: World-leading Design for Disassembly: 2,700 m² fully demountable timber pavilion with 95 pine columns designed for repeated relocation - moving to Medialukio school in 2026.

circular_features.description: 95 whole pine stem columns with bolted/screwed connections throughout - fully demountable
CLT wall elements, LVL roof elements, glulam beams and trusses - all designed for repeated disassembly and relocation

quantity.description: Total building area designed for multiple relocations

circular_features.description: Steel pile foundation enabling relocation without permanent ground works
Modules up to 18 tonnes designed for crane lifting during relocation to Medialukio (Feb-May 2026)

co2_reduction.note: Full building LCA exists in Aalto master thesis but not publicly accessible. Event-level operational footprint: 55.5-67.5 kgCO2e per seminar (520 attendees)

circularity_rate.note: DfD approach - 100% of structural elements designed for reuse/relocation

primary.title: Aalto Master Thesis - Lifecycle carbon footprint
primary.note: Full LCA data, requires direct access

data_completeness.upgrade_path: Obtain Aalto thesis PDF for full LCA data

narrative.driver: Helsinki City needed temporary event venue while Finlandia Hall was under renovation. Pioneering approach: design building to be relocated rather than demolished after temporary use.
narrative.approach: Full Design for Disassembly with bolted connections, modular timber elements (CLT, LVL, glulam), and steel pile foundation. Building will move to Medialukio school as additional space in 2026.
challenges: Designing timber connections for repeated disassembly
Logistics of moving 18-tonne modules by crane
Meeting building codes for temporary/relocatable structures
narrative.lessons_learned: DfD timber buildings are technically and economically viable. Key: design from the start for disassembly, not as an afterthought. Steel pile foundations enable relocation without ground disturbance.
